{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3551369,"name":"Jake Loten","username":"JakeLoten","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jakeloten/{size}/142734_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-08T20:23:11.679Z","cooked":"

Looking for advice. As our elevator is extending in auto our battery voltage is spiking to 16.5v and causing a brown out.

Not a problem in Teleop.

Was fine at our own shop, started in our first match.

IMG_07205712×4284 5.01 MB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-08T20:23:11.679Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":32,"reads":296,"readers_count":295,"score":219.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494770,"topic_slug":"high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout","display_username":"Jake Loten","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":36202,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RoboBitz / 2200: Design & Strategy"},"post_url":"/t/high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout/494770/1","custom_user_title":"RoboBitz / 2200: Design & Strategy","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3551376,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-08T20:30:09.366Z","cooked":"

I take it this is happening not when the elevator is extending, but rather when it’s retracting back to the ground and gravity is pulling it down back driving a motor?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-08T20:30:09.366Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":278,"readers_count":277,"score":150.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494770,"topic_slug":"high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout","display_username":"Joseph Walters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout/494770/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3551378,"name":"JamesCH95","username":"JamesCH95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jamesch95/{size}/1200_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-08T20:30:31.346Z","cooked":"

High battery voltage is probably a result of one motor being driven as a generator. Make sure all the motors in the system are working together.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-08T20:30:53.802Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":276,"readers_count":275,"score":125.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494770,"topic_slug":"high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout","display_username":"JamesCH95","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":3782,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout/494770/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3551392,"name":"Adam Bochek","username":"Bochek","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bochek/{size}/2414_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-08T20:47:53.431Z","cooked":"

This is happening while extending. We are planning on graphing in Phoenix tuner next to get a better idea of what’s going on

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-08T20:47:53.431Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":271,"readers_count":270,"score":74.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494770,"topic_slug":"high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout","display_username":"Adam Bochek","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63541,"username":"Jwal","name":"Joseph Walters","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7271,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RoboBitz / 2200 Coach"},"post_url":"/t/high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout/494770/4","custom_user_title":"RoboBitz / 2200 Coach","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3551396,"name":"JamesCH95","username":"JamesCH95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jamesch95/{size}/1200_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-08T20:56:13.936Z","cooked":"

Be aware that 16.5V is a very high voltage for a lead acid battery to see. If this is real, not a measurement error, try not to expose more than one battery to it while diagnosing and carefully inspect that battery.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-08T20:56:13.936Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":263,"readers_count":262,"score":82.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494770,"topic_slug":"high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout","display_username":"JamesCH95","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":3782,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout/494770/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3551504,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-08T23:33:21.673Z","cooked":"

While they gather more data on exactly when the rise in system voltage is occuring - how would a team solve the potential issue I proposed of early in the match a gravity back-driven motor causing an over voltage event? I haven’t delt with this in FRC and my electronic designs are often tolerant of excursions like this.

Would the best approach be to add a load to sink the energy? Like engage the drivetrain before bringing down the elevator to have somewhere for the energy to go?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-08T23:48:47.975Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":227,"readers_count":226,"score":55.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":494770,"topic_slug":"high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout","display_username":"Joseph Walters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":3782,"username":"JamesCH95","name":"JamesCH95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jamesch95/{size}/1200_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout/494770/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3551511,"name":"JamesCH95","username":"JamesCH95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jamesch95/{size}/1200_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-08T23:46:57.500Z","cooked":"

I have never see a battery unable to absorb the energy of a back-driven motor, or motors, on an FRC battery.

If the battery disconnects while the robot is moving really fast there can be huge voltage spikes. I think @Ty_Tremblay cooked a Lime Light like this, or a similar circumstance.

Speaking of… one of the few ways to see a voltage spike AND brown-out at around the same time is due to loose main power connections. @JakeLoten check everything. All main power lugs should be very firm against a strong wiggle. The SB contacts should be very smooth and free of arc damage. The main breaker better not be an Opti-Fuse brand. Ensure no loose strands and proper insertion depth at the PDM/PDP/etc lever nut terminals.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-08T23:46:57.500Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":212,"readers_count":211,"score":82.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":494770,"topic_slug":"high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout","display_username":"JamesCH95","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63541,"username":"Jwal","name":"Joseph Walters","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":3782,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout/494770/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3551514,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-08T23:50:14.814Z","cooked":"
Jwal:

gravity back driven motor

The only time I’ve seen damaging backdriving emf due to stored kinetic energy is when the lead acid battery is removed from the system and stops acting as a sink. And it was a cooked limelight 2…

An idle elevator motor getting driven as a generator is much more plausible than gravity, just in terms of energy.

A bad electrical connection resulting in Bizarre Behavior is even more plausible.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-08T23:51:28.331Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":203,"readers_count":202,"score":60.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494770,"topic_slug":"high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout","display_username":"s-neff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28019,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout/494770/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3551515,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-08T23:53:43.694Z","cooked":"

That’s a great point!

If there were a high resistance point in mains power wiring, back-driven current may cause a rise in robot-side wiring voltage (where a PDP or PDH or RIO are measuring system voltage).

Or when using a large amount of current like driving the system would brownout as voltage dropped across the high resistance point.

This feels likely as OP’s root cause.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-08T23:53:43.694Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":188,"readers_count":187,"score":52.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494770,"topic_slug":"high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout","display_username":"Joseph Walters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":3782,"username":"JamesCH95","name":"JamesCH95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jamesch95/{size}/1200_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout/494770/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3551519,"name":"Joe Ross","username":"Joe_Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-08T23:56:27.925Z","cooked":"
JamesCH95:

Speaking of… one of the few ways to see a voltage spike AND brown-out at around the same time is due to loose main power connections.

I suspect it isn’t a true brownout, but rather the roborio entering brownout protection in response to a high voltage just like it does for a low voltage. For example like on this thread:

Gyro Issue, Voltage Spike Control System
After running practice matches at our current event we’re seeing an issue that we can’t seem to explain for fix, even after consulting with a number of knowledgeable field staff, including going up the chain to HQ. What we are experiencing is our gyro not returning proper values about 3 seconds into our autonomous routine, which seems to correspond to a voltage spike of up to nearly 16 V, according to our driver station logs. This spike corresponds with a period of aggressive negative accelerat…
","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-08T23:56:27.925Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":179,"readers_count":178,"score":55.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":494770,"topic_slug":"high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout","display_username":"Joe Ross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/gyro-issue-voltage-spike/164903","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Gyro Issue, Voltage Spike","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":65,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout/494770/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"thinking","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3551553,"name":"garyk","username":"garyk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/garyk/{size}/113200_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-09T00:56:20.271Z","cooked":"

Happens with other batteries?

Where are you taking this measuremen? - at the battery? PD board? At the motor itself?

Are there two elevator motors? One at a time, pull its fuse. Same problem on each? Same speed?

But happening in Auton, not Teleop, suggests software. Code same on both?

The voltage reported on the driver station (and therefore in the DS Logs) is read at the Rio power input

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-09T12:43:25.418Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":111,"readers_count":110,"score":27.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494770,"topic_slug":"high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7232,"username":"garyk","name":"garyk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/garyk/{size}/113200_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/high-battery-voltage-causing-brownout/494770/13","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3551807,"name":"Adam Bochek","username":"Bochek","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bochek/{size}/2414_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-09T12:47:54.761Z","cooked":"

To wrap this up…

The issue we are seeing is not what we originally thought. The voltage spike and associated brownout is caused by the elevator stopping on the way down.

This is not the source of the main problem we were trying to diagnose. We just happened to catch it in the DS logs and assumed it was our problem.

I’m not sure much can be done about this spike except giving the elevator more room to brake. I’m also not sure it’s something that needs to be fixed.

As others have stated, the voltage rise is due to a motor operating in the regeneration mode. The battery should be able to absorb this energy and prevent a significant rise in the system voltage. Please pop the contacts out of the SB50 housing for the battery in question and on your robot. Look for copper color in the areas highlighted in green. This would indicate that the silver plating that reduces the contact resistance has worn off. If the highlighted area is rough, the contact resistance would be compromised further.

worn Anderson contact872×852 145 KB
